business_hypothesis: Higher brand search volume drives increases in campaign_sub_metric_1.
science_hypothesis: There is a strong positive linear relationship (Pearson r ≥ 0.60) between brand_search_volume and campaign_sub_metric_1 after removing seasonal/date effects.
null_case: No relationship: detrended/deseasonalized Pearson r ∈ [-0.10, 0.10], bootstrap p > 0.05, and 95% bootstrap CI includes 0.

validation_methods.execution_plan: Detrend and deseasonalize brand_search_volume and campaign_sub_metric_1 by fitting an STL decomposition on date and compute Pearson correlation on the residuals with 10,000 bootstrap samples to estimate confidence intervals. Pass if Pearson r ≥ 0.60, bootstrap two-sided p-value < 0.01, and the 95% bootstrap CI does not include 0.

Apply exponential decay weights (half-life = 28 days) to observations and compute weighted Pearson correlation and rolling 30-day correlations across the series to detect temporal consistency. Pass if weighted r ≥ 0.55 and ≥ 80% of rolling 30-day windows show r > 0.40 with p < 0.05.

Run 10,000 label permutations of brand_search_volume while keeping campaign_sub_metric_1 fixed (after seasonal adjustment) to compute the null distribution of Pearson r. Pass if the observed r exceeds the 99th percentile of the null distribution (permutation p < 0.01).
